Dispute_Type: Regulatory compliance for issuing a Notice of Compliance (NOC) for additional drug indications
Legal_Issue: Whether the Minister is precluded by s. 7(1)(b) of the NOC Regulations from issuing an NOC to Apotex for new claims without a fresh NOA served on Merck
Evidence_Assessment: Apotex served a 1993 NOA regarding Lovastatin's manufacture and use; Merck challenged only the manufacturing process, not the new claims
Decision_Outcome: The Minister is not precluded from issuing the NOC
Burden_of_Proof: On Apotex to demonstrate compliance with s. 5 of the NOC Regulations
Legal_Rule: Under s. 7(1)(b), the Minister cannot issue an NOC until the second person complies with s. 5, which requires alleging non-infringement or accepting patent expiration
Procedural_Issue: Requirement of a fresh NOA for new claims
Grounds_for_Claim: Apotex complied with s. 5 via the 1993 NOA, giving Merck opportunity to contest but did not
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Allowed issuance of NOC without new NOA
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Merck had prior opportunity to contest the new claims but did not
Key_Evidence_Considered: 1993 NOA, scope of Merck's challenge limited to manufacturing process
Applicant_Challenge: Apotex seeking NOC for new claims
Defendant_Response: Merck challenged only the manufacturing process, not the new claims
Remedy_Requested: Issuance of NOC for additional indications
Outcome: NOC allowed without requirement for new NOA
Decision_Authority: Minister of Health, subject to court interpretation
Remedy_Sought: Notice of Compliance for new claims
Claimant_Status: Apotex as second person under NOC Regulations
Applicable_Process: Regulatory approval process under NOC Regulations
